intro: Ecclinusa orinocoensis, commonly known as the Orinoco ecclinusa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Ecclinusa orinocoensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a habitat for various insects and small animals.
